bt boost its broadband package  british telecom have say it will double the broadband speed of most of its home and business customers  the increase speed will come at no extra charge and follow a similar move by internet service provider aol many bt customers will now have download speed of 2mbps although there be usage allowance of between one gigabyte and 30 gigabytes a month the new speed start to come into effect on 17 february for home customers and 1 april for businesses britain be now broadband britain say duncan ingram bt manage director broadband and internet service he add ninety percent of our customers will see real increase in speed  these speed increase will give people the opportunity to do a lot more with their broadband connections he say upload speed - the speed at which information be send from a pc via broadband - will remain at the same speed say mr ingram despite the increase bt will continue to have usage allowance for home customers the allowance be extremely generous say mr ingram for what we be see in the market place - they be really not an issue bt will begin enforce the allowance in the summer customers who exceed the amount will either be able to pay for a bigger allowance or see their download speed reduce bt now have a 36% share of the broadband market - down from 39% - which be become increasingly competitive in the last few months many rival isps have begin to offer 2mbps service include aol plusnet and uk online  but britain continue to lag behind some countries - especially japan and south korea - which offer broadband speed of up to 40mbps but mr ingram say it be important to separate hype from reality he say that a limit number of people with those connections consistently receive speed of 40mbps customers will not see their connections double immediately on 17 february mr ingram say there would be a roll out across the network in order to prevent any problems

re-legislate to remove ambiguity over how murderers should be sentence it be also call on the senior judge in england and wales lord woolf to abandon draft guidelines he propose in september to reduce sentence of murderers who plead guilty the committee say the plan have not reflect the public disquiet express over the possibility of significantly reduce prison term for murderers lord woolf sentence guidelines council (sgc) cause further controversy by suggest a one third discount off sentence for early guilty pleas in all type of crime as a result murderers who face a 15-year tariff could get five years knock off if they give themselves up to the police  mr denham believe the sgc should reconsider its proposals to reflect parliament wish that murder should be treat as a separate and especially grave category of offence he say we want to see sentencers advise that in the case of murder reduction in sentence for a guilty plea should not normally be grant in addition to reductions for other mitigate circumstances but a spokesman for the home office defend the proposals he say by make express provision for murder tariff in the criminal justice act parliament send a no half measure with half-life 2  could half-life 2 possibly live up to the hype after almost two years of tantalise preview and infuriate delay it safe to say that this be the most highly-anticipated be endlessly refine to get as close to perfection as could realistically be hop all the money - or indeed time - be on the screen the player see things through the eye of gordon freeman the bespectacled scientist who star in the original 1998 half-life have survive that skirmish in an desolate monster-infested research facility he back in another forebode troublespot - the enigmatic city 17 it have the look of a beautiful eastern european city but as soon as your train pull in to the station it clear that all be not well here sinister police patrol the unkempt streets and the oppressive atmosphere clobber you like a sledgehammer a casual smatter of the nightmarish creatures from the first game make this an even less pleasant place to be  you be herd around like a prisoner and have to mingle with a few freedom-fighting civilians to gather information and progress in your task it be not immediately explain what your objectives be nor precisely why everything be so ravage find out step-by-step be all part of the experience although you never fully get to understand what it be all about that do not really matter hl2 do not waste energy blind you with plot underplay the narrative in this way be gloriously effective and immerse the player in the most vivid convince and impressive virtual world they be likely to have see there be no cut-scenes to interrupt the flow exposition be accomplish by other character stop to talk directly to you  whereas the highly impressive doom iii felt like a top-notch theme park thrill-ride wander through half-life world truly do feel like be part of a movie  consider its sophistication the game run surprisingly well on computers that only just match the modest minimum specifications but if ever there be an incentive to upgrade your pc components this be it on our test machine - an alienware system with an athlon 3500+ processor and ati radeon x800 video card - everything run at full quality without trouble and the visual experience be simply jaw-dropping it be not simply that the surface textures and light effect push the technical envelope without mercy but that such care and artistic flair have go into design them the haunt grim landscape become strangely beautiful luckily you get time to pause mid-task and marvel at the awesome graphical flourish of your surround so impressive be the physics that you'll find yourself hurl bits of rubbish around and prod float corpses just to marvel at the lifelike way they move there be puzzle to be solve along the way pitch at about the right difficulty but most progress be achieve by force freeman be quickly reunite with the original game famous crowbar and an array of more sophisticate weapons soon follow  virtually anything not nail to the floor can be interact with and in realistic fashion you will be wow by the attention-to-detail as you chip bits of plaster off wall chase a pigeon out of your way or dodge explode barrel as they ping around at deadly speed at time half-life 2 feel like one of those annoy people who be unfeasibly brilliant at everything they turn their hand to and in a curious way its unrelenting goodness actually become almost tiresome run around on foot be great enough but jump into vehicles prove even more fun human foes be render just as well as alien ones the stealth section be as exhilarate as the open gun battle in gameplay term hl2 somehow get almost everything perfect and without resort to the zombies-leaping-out-of-shadows approach of doom iii it all incredibly unsettle the vacant environment be distinctly eerie and at one point i even catch myself hesitate to go down a murky tunnel for fear of what might be inside  the game do have a couple of problems firstly the carefully-scripted way that you progress through each level might irk some people  a lot of things be meticulously choreograph to happen on cue which make for excite moments but may be an annoyance to some players and limit the appeal of play again once you've complete it if you like things open-ended and free-ranging far cry will be a lot more please but the real downside be the hassle of get the game to run instal it prove a life-draining siege that would test a saint patience developer valve have rashly assume that everyone want to play the game will have an internet connection and it force you to go online to authenticate your copy the box do warn you of this anti-piracy measure but do not say just how many components have to be download the time spend do this will depend on your connection speed the temperamental valve servers and the time of day but it can take hours it would take a mighty piece of work to feel worthwhile after such annoyances - but luckily half-life 2 be up to the challenge it constitutional amendments to balance the budget the public outcry will force congress to act whether it will act wisely be another matter how do this happen  by definition the deficit mean too little multi-purpose tv aid india  two-thirds of the world population 4 billion people live on $2000 a year or less  you might think that the last thing on their mind would be get a television set or a computer but that not the case many people in the develop world give up one of their daily meals so they can afford to buy a tv and now an indian-born computer engineer think he come up with a way to give them cheap access to the internet carnegie mellon professor raj reddy have spend the bulk of his professional career try to find ways to make technology accessible to poor people the first step be to figure out why poor people would want a personal computer and professor reddy think he have a pretty good idea of why they might i come from a village say prof reddy i know what the population be like many of them be illiterate and many of them have other concern there nobody will use it for the conventional use of a pc word process and powerpoint he say so it clear to me that if people want to use pcs in a village - it have to usable by illiterate people and it must be primarily for entertainment education telemedicine and access to expert advice  prof reddy also think that tie it into some kind of aid package be the wrong approach after all he ask -- what aid group could possibly give expensive computers to 250 million less fortunate indians let alone the billions of poor people around the world  instead prof reddy decide to think of those 250 million indians as a potential market the problem then become one of make the product compel enough it must be so compel that you would give up your third meal in order to have this prof reddy say people do this today with television set if you go to india and many other countries they will first go get a television set before they worry about one more meal why because personalize entertainment have become very important this hatch a completely new idea he call it a pctvt - a personal computer television and telephone all in one that run on a normal desktop machine literate users can surf through the applications with a keyboard and mouse but illiterate users can use what look like a television remote control  on the screen picture - not word - designate applications like tv voice mail and video e-mail this dependence on graphics video and audio mean that a computer for an illiterate person need 100 time more power and more memory than one for a phd prassana rambathla one of prof reddy graduate students say that when you're talk illiterate you're talk audio and video and that demand exponentially high bandwidth' it can't choke at any point in time and it have to withstand anything no matter what you're press the major part be make it foolproof very tough so that it never break he say the carnegie mellon team say this project be only possible because pcs be now so much cheaper and have built-in audio and video hardware and software limit trials of the pctvt be due to start this month in the indian state of andhra pradesh  although andhra pradesh have a fairly good infrastructure but work have to be do to ensure reliable connections to the net prof reddy have team up with eric brewer at the university of california at berkeley the answer say prof brewer be wi-fi  we're look at the thing you'll see in starbuck or many other hotspots he say we're do a lot of work on long-distance wireless and how to make the network work better in the presence of intermittency when the power go up and down and the link go up and down and the computers you're connect to just get turn off for no reason prof reddy say he hop to lease the pctvts for about $10 a month and think indians will rent the units for the television and dvd capabilities reddy say he can then introduce the pctvt other technologies - such as video mail for example a farmer could use the pctvt webcam to send a picture of a harmful insect to a local official who could send back a propose course of action to the farmer prof reddy think this kind of communication be the real pay-off the underlie problem he say be how you can increase their wealth and reduce their poverty and reduce their illiteracy and improve their health care' and what i'm postulate be that this be the technology that will enable them if i didn't have it it would be an uphill battle even with the technology it an uphill battle but i have a tool there be hope i can reach them in ways that have not be possible before  clark boyd be technology correspondent for the world a bbc world service and wgbh-boston co-production

graphics be a curiously long way behind those of the xbox version the pivotal element behind battlefront success be that it successfully give you the feel of be of be plunge into the midst of large-scale war the number of combatants noise and abundance of laser fire see to that and the sense of chaos really come over  speak of noise battlefront be a real testament to the strength of the star war galaxy audio motifs  the multitude of distinctive weapon and vehicle noise be immensely familiar as be the stir john williams symphonies that never let up there be also a particularly snazzy remix of one of his theme in the menu section it have to be say if the game do not have the boon of be star war it would not stand up for long the gameplay be reliable bog-standard stuff short on originality there be also odd annoyances like the game insistence on re-spawning you miles away from the action an irritate price to pay for not get blow up the second you appear and some of the weapons and vehicles be not as responsive and fluid to operate as they might be that say it be still great fun to pilot a scout walker or speeder bike however non user-friendly they prove whilst it be firmly design with multiplayer action in mind battlefront be actually perfectly good fun as an offline game the above-average ai of the enemy see to that although give the frenetic environments they operate in their strategic behaviour do not need to be all that sophisticate battlefront novelty value will doubtless wear off relatively fast leave behind a slightly empty one-trick-pony of a game
